intro: Rollinia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaf rollinia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters in height. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape with a smooth margin. Its flowers are small and clustered in panicles, typically appearing in yellow or green hues. The fruit is a fleshy, spiny capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
